content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Great subject, should be fun in these modes, clearly not a subject for reverse but with the explanations it can be great to play. Nice contribution !

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Everything in the puzzle makes sense to me, and it's not too easy that it's not challenging at all.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice challenge to have to split up a word according to syllables.

Nice one - but most of my time was spent on typing the syllable-value dictionary, which felt like a boring activity. It might help if you would provide in the statement the syllables already in string format (i.e. 'o', 'i', ...).

Cases
* Please add a test to cover "ni" (2) and "na" (7). (Validator coverage is fine.)

Thanks.

Thanks for the feedback, I've added quotes to the syllables now.

I used double-quotes, since I think C-like languages use single quotes exclusively for single characters, so I'm hoping double quotes are more universal here. Most languages seem to be able to use either though.
